item.title: 10am lecture cancelled – Thursday 16th January

item.description: Due to unforeseen circumstances Julie Cavanagh’s public health lecture scheduled for tomorrow morning has been cancelled at 10am. Apologies for this inconvenience.

Due to unforeseen circumstances Julie Cavanagh’s public health lecture scheduled for tomorrow morning has been cancelled at 10am.

Apologies for this inconvenience.

item.title: Cardiovascular Course 2014
item.dc:creator: Alison Gray
item.description:
Students – the cardiovascular course for 2014 commences on Monday 6 January 2014.  This site is currently being updated to reflect the new course.  Please note that content will be updated by Tuesday 31 December 2013. Wishing you all a…
Read more ›
item.content:encoded:
Students – the cardiovascular course for 2014 commences on Monday 6 January 2014.  This site is currently being updated to reflect the new course.  Please note that content will be updated by Tuesday 31 December 2013.

Wishing you all a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year.

item.title: Want to help create the next version of Kumar and Clark?
item.dc:creator: Ellie Hothersall
item.description:
I’ve been approached by Elsevier, who publish Kumar and Clark. They’d like to set up a student focus group to look at how to improve the next edition of the book, and how to make an electronic version as useful…
Read more ›
item.content:encoded: I’ve been approached by Elsevier, who publish Kumar and Clark. They’d like to set up a student focus group to look at how to improve the next edition of the book, and how to make an electronic version as useful as possible. If you’re interested, please let me know ASAP – I think there are both refreshments and book tokens on offer!

item.title: Want to help create the next version of Kumar and Clark?

I’ve been approached by Elsevier, who publish Kumar and Clark. They’d like to set up a student focus group to look at how to improve the next edition of the book, and how to make an electronic version as useful…

item.content:encoded: I’ve been approached by Elsevier, who publish Kumar and Clark. They’d like to set up a student focus group to look at how to improve the next edition of the book, and how to make an electronic version as useful as possible. If you’re interested, please let me know ASAP – I think there are both refreshments and book tokens on offer!

item.title: SiP End of Semester feedback form 2013-2014
item.dc:creator: Olga Remers
item.description:
The SiP End of Semester system feedback form is now available for your completion. You can access the form via medblogs by clicking on your respective Year then Introduction, then click on the Tab “feedback” then “forms and responses” or…
Read more ›
item.content:encoded:
The SiP End of Semester system feedback form is now available for your completion. You can access the form via medblogs by clicking on your respective Year then Introduction, then click on the Tab “feedback” then “forms and responses” or alternatively by clicking here:-

http://www.survey.dundee.ac.uk/sipendofsem12014

The feedback form will be available until midnight on Sunday 22nd December 2013. We are aware that this is a very busy time of year for all of you with various deadlines, preparations and travel arrangements, not forgetting the Christmas festivities so, can we ask that you share this with your colleagues to ensure that you meet this deadline as non-completion may result in a Lapse of Professionalism point being issued.

Wishing you a merry Christmas

item.title: Evaluation of #fluscenario

item.description: The fluscenario project has nearly come to an end for this year, and I’d be very grateful if you’d give us some feedback via this form
item.content:encoded: The fluscenario project has nearly come to an end for this year, and I’d be very grateful if you’d give us some feedback via this form

item.title: FAME Awareness Day 1pm Tuesday 3rd December
item.dc:creator: Iona Campbell
item.description:
This Tuesday 3rd December, the FaME committee will be running an awareness day at lunchtime. We will be able to answer any questions you have about the awards, nominations, voting etc. Voting forms will be available for you to submit…
Read more ›
item.content:encoded:
This Tuesday 3rd December, the FaME committee will be running an awareness day at lunchtime. We will be able to answer any questions you have about the awards, nominations, voting etc. Voting forms will be available for you to submit a nomination there and then! In return we will be offering free pens and a celebrations to see you through your afternoon sessions!
So that’s 1pm, Tuesday 3rd December Blue Carpet Area at Ninewells! Come say hello!

item.title: Scenario 4 of #fluscenario live now

item.content:encoded:

item.title: SCRCOG Careers Fair – Friday 22/11/13
item.dc:creator: Antony Nicoll
item.description:
The Scottish Committee of the Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists annual careers fair takes place on Friday 22 November in Glasgow. This is a free event and there will be free transport from Dundee.  You can find more information…
Read more ›
item.content:encoded:
The Scottish Committee of the Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists annual careers fair takes place on Friday 22 November in Glasgow.

This is a free event and there will be free transport from Dundee.  You can find more information about the event here.  There are a few students who are now unable to attend and so there are still spaces available on the bus. The bus will leave from the main entrance at Ninewells Hospital at 8am.

If you are interested in a career in O&G and would like to attend this event please contact me (antony.nicoll@nhs.net).
